intro: Senecio litvinovii, commonly known as the Litvinov's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southwestern North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its small, yellowish flowers are surrounded by pale green bracts, and it produces fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. Senecio litvinovii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
